results.title: A story of boys and girls = Storia di ragazzi e di ragazze
results.creator_credit: Pupi Avati, Antonio Avati, RAIUNO and Duea Film
results.brief_description: Angelo, who is from a rich family in Bologna, is engaged to the very beautiful Silvia who is the daughter of peasants in the Italian countryside. To celebrate the engagement, Angelo and Silvia’s families are to come together for a grand lunch at the home of her parents. As the wine flows and the sumptious meal is consumed, family secrets and resentments come to the surface and threaten the young couple’s happiness. Set in the thirties, the rigid codes which govern peasant life are already beginning to become undone: Mussolini is beginning his ascendancy; the dictates of family honour and fidelity are being defied; the centuries old division between poor and the rich is being questioned. But for Angelo and Silvia, caught up in the passion of their love, everything else is secondary. Charming, comic and beautifully filmed “A Story of Boys and Girls” is a rewarding film about the ties of love, family and honour; a film about the last moment in a young nation’s life where it knew peace before the advent of a World War which would tear it apart.

results.title: A Steam train passes
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A nostalgic essay on one of the majestic but now retired C38 class steam locomotives filmed on one of its final journeys from Sydney to a series of country railway stations. The film opens with a 1943 Cinesound newsreel depicting the track trials of the first of the C38 engines. The original soundtrack provides the only commentary.

results.title: A state of illiteracy
results.brief_description: This program focuses on the state of illiteracy in Australia. It examines the reasons why people may be illiterate and the ways in which they cope with illiteracy in today’s society. The stigma of illiteracy (the assumption that to be illiterate is to be mentally deficient) is explored. Interviews with illiterate people from different sectors of the community are conducted and adult literacy courses are also examined. Presented by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: A single life: Ethel May 'Monte' Punshon 1882-1989
results.creator_credit: Nancy Peck and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Produced with the assistance of the Australian Womens Archival Project, Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission, the interview filmed over two days in September 1988 when Monte Punshon was nearly 106 years old. The retired teacher of Japanese talks about her life and philosophy. She lived through two World Wars and two sightings of Hailey’s Comet. She was born in 1882 and died in 1989 at the age of 106. Monte squeezed several lifetimes into one, working as a governess, radio announcer, detention camp commander and author. She had a sixty year association with Japan, including being awarded one of Japan’s highest honours. A biographical guide to her life is included inside the video cover.

results.title: A Simple plan
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Adam Schroeder, James Jacks, Paramount Pictures and Mutual Film Company
results.brief_description: When three men (Bill Paxton, Billy Bob Thornton, Brent Briscoe) find a duffle bag full of money in a plane wreck in the Minnesota woods, they decide to hold onto it. If no-one claims the money they’ll divide it between them and leave town. If it is claimed however, they’ll burn it so that it can’t be traced to them. Even the simplest of plans can start to unravel though when there’s a 4.4 million secret at stake. A taught thriller which shows just what lengths some people will go to to acquire the American dream.

results.title: A Sunday in the Country = Un Dimanche a la Campagne
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Alain Sarde, Little Bear, Films A2 and Sara Films
results.brief_description: A poignant and gently paced portrayal of one day in the life of M. Ladmiral, a French painter nearing the end of his life. As is usual on Sundays, M. Ladmiral is visited at his country home by his children from the city - the devoted Edouard with his petit bourgeois wife and three children and the lively Irene, M. Ladmiral’s beautiful daughter. This Sunday, as the day unfolds, a telling family portrait is gradually revealed with the sensitivity that only Tavernier can bring to the screen.

results.title: A Streetcar named Desire
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Charles K. Feldman
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Stars Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando. Based on the play by Tennessee Williams. Also stars Karl Malden.

results.title: A Story of women = Une Affaire de femmes
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Marin Karmitz and MK2 Productions
results.brief_description:
‘Une Affaire de Femmes’ has been hailed as one of Chabrol’s finest films. Based on the true story of Marie-Louise Giraud, a wartime mother and abortionist. Since the age of fourteen, Marie has been married to Paul, and has been a devoted and dedicated wife. When Paul returns from the war, he finds that life has changed. Marie-Louise has kept the home and family together and has plenty of money from her illegal business. She decides she no longer needs or wants Paul. The film exposes hypocrisy in its political and personal manifestations. Isabelle Huppert and Francois Cluzet star in this film which won an award for Huppert at the Venice Film festival and which was voted best film at the Melbourne International Film Festival in 1989.
Cast also includes: Marie Trintignant, Nils Tavernier
